result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Maples

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:01 AM COurt calls cases: 22CF47, 22CF61 DA Kelz states appearances. Defendant Christopher A. Maples in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is not ready to proceed with today's hearing and that he has some letters he would like to read to the court. Court questions defendant on whether he wishes to obtain counsel. Defendant gives responses. Court addresses the defendant on status of counsel. Defendant states he would like counsel however he does not qualify for SPD nor has he qualified for a Court appointed Attorney. Defendant again asks to read his letter to the court. Court allows the defendant to address the court and read his letter aloud. Defendant reads letters aloud. Court questions Defendant and states there is a procedural process in going to a jury trial and that the case he wants a jury trial in is not on the docket today. Court questions defendant on how he wants to proceed with the cases that are on the docket today. Defendant gives responses. Court questions DA Kelz on Court appointed Attorney. DA Kelz gives responses. Court questions Defendant states he has filled out a Petition for Court appointed Attorney. Court questions the clerk on the status of that Petition. Clerk responds by stating the Judicial Assistant is out as well as the judge so there is no way of knowing the status of that paperwork. Court states being a request for an Attorney has been made by the defendant today's hearings need to be adjourned to allow that paperwork to run its course. DA Kelz concurs. Clerk verifies the defendant's current contact information. Comments by the defendant. Statements and comments by the court. Parties to schedule with the judicial Assistant to get these matters back on the courts calendar at a later date.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:44 AM DA calls cases 22CF47 and 22CF61 case and states appearances. Defendant Christopher A. Maples appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on non appearance. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant. So ordered. DA Kelz states he has no objection to the previous bond being reinstated. So Ordered. Defendant requests a copy of court dates that are scheduled. Court advises the defendant on how he can obtain those dates and times.
Return on warrant on June 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:33 PM DA Kelz calls cases: 22CF47 and 22CF61 and states appearances. Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A. Maples not in court. Court goes over the history of appearances and notices sent. DA Kelz moves for a bench warrant in each matter as well as bond forfeiture proceedings. So ordered plus warrant fees.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Not operate moving vehicle without valid driver license. If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

10:28 AM Defendant Christopher A. Maples in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits not waived. Notice of right to attorney given to DE. If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
